title: Lockport football upsets Bolingbrook
text:
Minooka football stumbles at Oswego East, falls 17-8 
For the first time since the 2009 season, Lockport came away with a victory in the SouthWest Suburban Blue conference matchup, winning 33-16. 
Bolingbrook (4-4, 3-3) scored on the third play of the game when quarterback Joseph Coates ran 68 yards for the initial touchdown. 
After a three-and-out by the Porters, Bolingbrook put together a 10-play drive that resulted in a 26-yard field goal by Gino Carcerano to give the Raiders a 10-0 lead at the 4:36 mark of the first quarter. 
Lockport (3-5, 3-3) scored 19 second-quarter points with the help of three Bolingbrook turnovers. 
After a Lockport fumble, the Raiders made it 19-16 at the half on an incredible one-handed touchdown grab by Tuf Borland. 
That was as close as the Raiders would get as Lockport took advantage of four second-half turnovers by Bolingbrook and cruised to the 17-point victory. 
Deiondre Taylor threw a 29-yard touchdown pass to quarterback Ben Davis and also had a 40-yard touchdown run to lead the Porters.
